comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to NYT of September 19, 1915, which reviews the August 1914 Battle of Tannenberg, the extent of the 7-day battle was large and included many towns/villages, not just Tannenberg itself. Hohenstein is said to be 8.1 miles from Tannenberg. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E0DE6D61731E733A... Hohenstein is now en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olsztynek in Poland. It is the site of a memorial associated with the Battle of Tannenberg. See www.ostpreussen.net/ostpreussen/orte.php?bericht=687 [German], en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tannenberg_Memorial and info-poland.buffalo.edu/classroom/JM/monument.html (English based on a Polish website) In August 1933, Hitler chose it as the site for a mausoleum for Field Marshal Hindenburg.
